arm_group.description: Getting one time one hour of Khalifa's therapy for ACL injury treatment.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary hypothesis is that Khalifa's therapy has different acute effects in various
      organ systems i.e. proprioceptive, neuro-muscular, endogenous dopamine system, etc. These
      effects might indicate the pathway of the therapy.

clinical_study.condition: Totally Ruptured Anterior Cruciate Ligament in the Knee

detailed_description.textblock:
According to our previous study that evaluated the efficacy of Khalifa's therapy the
      investigators have seen that the therapy has acute effects which resulted in better knee
      function and later even in better healing of the ACL injury. This study should clear exactly
      which effects and pathways are involved in the therapy from multiple (interdisciplinary)
      point of views. Therefore the investigators will measure parameters that might be associated
      with this special technique directly before and after the therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  totally ruptured ACL - MRI verified, 2 weeks old as a maximum

          -  knee function: Any functional inhibition (stretching, bending or load)

          -  BMI: 18-25

          -  athletically active

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  any surgical procedures at the injured knee at any previous time

          -  any acute surgical indication

          -  diabetes mellitus and/or high blood pressure

          -  any permanent drug treatment

intervention.description: One hour of Khalifa's therapy which is specially applied pressure to the skin.

clinical_study.official_title: Interdisciplinary Evaluation of Acute Effects From Khalifa's Therapy at Patients With Fully Ruptured Anterior Cruciate Ligament (ACL).

primary_outcome.description: IKDC Score KT-1000 test Clinical / physical examination
Posturomed Motion capture proprioception muscle power range of motion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Different questions about pain, lifestyle, subjective parameters

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
